title: Corleck Head: A spooky three-faced Celtic sculpture found on the 'Hill of Death' in Ireland — and it may have been connected to human sacrifice 1,900 years ago
summary: The meaning of the three-faced Corleck Head has puzzled experts for centuries.

title: 8 Best Space Heaters (2025): Tested, Measured, and Mistreated
summary: These portable heaters will heat a room quickly, quietly, and safely.

title: Science history: Edwin Hubble uncovers the vastness of the universe with discovery of 'standard candle' — Oct. 5, 1923
summary: On the night of Oct. 5, 1923, Edwin Hubble observed a strange star that flickered in intensity at regular intervals. The star, dubbed M31-V1, was key to showing that the universe extended far beyond the borders of the Milky Way.

title: The James Webb telescope proves Einstein right, 8 times over — Space photo of the week
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope's latest image shows eight spectacular examples of gravitational lensing, a phenomenon that Albert Einstein first predicted some 100 years ago.

title: Who discovered America?
summary: Christopher Columbus was far from the first person, and not even the first European, to reach the Americas.

title: Massive system of rotating ocean currents in the North Atlantic is behaving strangely — and it may be reaching a tipping point
summary: An analysis of clam shells suggests the North Atlantic subpolar gyre has had two periods of destabilization over the past 150 years: one around 1920 and the other from 1950 through present.

title: Plate tectonics may be why Earth has life — and the key to finding life elsewhere in the universe
summary: Emerging evidence suggests that plate tectonics, or the recycling of Earth's crust, may have begun much earlier than previously thought — and may be a big reason that our planet harbors life.

title: China Is Leading the World in the Clean Energy Transition. Here's What That Looks Like
summary: The country spends like no one else on renewables and has reshaped the global market. Is it enough?

title: Scientists could soon create a 'universal antivenom.' But would it save lives?
summary: A recent study hints that we could make a universal antivenom for snakebites, but some scientists say we need something else instead.

title: Harvest Moon 2025: Watch a rare October supermoon rise amid shooting stars
summary: The famous Harvest Moon — the first of three supermoons of 2025 — will be the first full moon of autumn when it rises on Oct. 6-7.

title: Anthropologists make 'ant yogurt' from centuries-old recipe, serve it as an 'ant-wich' at Michelin-star restaurant
summary: Researchers have revealed how adding a handful of live ants to warm milk can create yogurt.

title: إغلاق قناة "ناصر".. وأسرة عبد الناصر تتحرك لإنقاذ الأرشيف
summary: أقدمت منصة "يوتيوب" على إغلاق قناة "Nasser TV (ناصر تي في)" التي كانت تبث تسجيلات نادرة للرئيس المصري الراحل جمال عبد الناصر، في خطوة أثارت تفاعلًا واسعًا خلال الساعات الماضية، وسط سعي أسرته لاستعادتها أو البحث عن بدائل لنشر باقي تسجيلاته النادرة.

title: From tool use to warfare — here are 5 ways Jane Goodall revolutionized our knowledge of chimpanzees
summary: Pioneering primatologist Jane Goodall has died at age 91. These are her five biggest contributions to how we understand about our closest living relatives.

title: Scientists find best evidence yet that icy moon Enceladus is habitable
summary: An ocean flowing beneath the surface of Saturn's moon Enceladus is spewing ice that holds the building blocks of life.

title: Newly discovered comet 'Lemmon' may be visible to the naked eye this month — but it will look more like a lime
summary: Comet Lemmon, discovered earlier this year, will make a close approach to Earth later this month, giving skywatchers the chance to see its surprising lime-green glow.

title: Former Google CEO Will Fund Boat Drones to Explore Rough Antarctic Waters
summary: Scientists have a lot of questions about our planet’s most important carbon sink—and a new project could help answer them.

title: When China makes a climate pledge, the world should listen
summary: Beijing has a track record of only promising what it plans to deliver. But too often the world's attention is elsewhere.

title: Our solar system's asteroid belt is slowly disappearing
summary: A new analysis estimates that the asteroid belt is steadily losing mass each year, and may not be as permanent a feature of the solar system as we thought.

title: The Panama Canal needs a staggering amount of water to operate. Climate change could threaten that, study warns
summary: The vital commercial artery depends on a supply of fresh water to move ships between the two oceans. Drought conditions that were once rare could become common by the end of the century, greatly impacting the canal’s operation.

title: Jane Goodall, famed primatologist who discovered chimpanzee tool use, dies at 91
summary: Dame Jane Goodall, the world's preeminent chimpanzee expert, died of natural causes.

title: Bering Land Bridge emerged much later than we thought it did, new study finds
summary: The Bering Land Bridge likely didn't emerge until around 35,000 years ago, much later than was previously thought. This narrows the window of when humans could have crossed over to North America.

title: Yosemite's glaciers have survived 20,000 years — but we could be the first people to see Sierra Nevada ice-free
summary: New research finds the disappearance of glaciers in the Sierra Nevada will be unprecedented in the human history of North America.

title: A 'Great Wave' is rippling through our galaxy, pushing thousands of stars out of place
summary: A giant 'wave' is rippling through the Milky Way, pushing thousands of stars across the galaxy, and scientists don't know what triggered it.

title: Scientists have digitally removed the 'death masks' from four Colombian mummies, revealing their faces for the first time
summary: The reconstructions are based on the skulls of four mummified individuals who had masks tightly fitted on their faces.

title: Tutankhamun quiz: How much do you know about the famous boy king from ancient Egypt?
summary: King Tut's tomb has captivated people worldwide since its discovery in 1922. But how much do you actually know about the boy king? Take our quiz to find out.

title: Stars that brush past black holes live longer, stranger lives after their close encounters with death
summary: A new study shows survivor stars can live billions of years longer than normal, carrying chemical fingerprints of their violent encounters with the Milky Way's black hole.

title: أوروبا تبحث تحديث قواعد ملفات الارتباط لتسهيل التصفح
summary: تسعى المفوضية الأوروبية إلى جعل تصفح الإنترنت أكثر سهولة، عبر تخفيف قواعد الخصوصية، وإيجاد طريقة جديدة لإدارة ملفات الارتباط (الكوكيز).

title: جوائز "نوبل" الساخرة تكرّم أصحاب أغرب البحوث والاختراعات
summary: حصلت اختراعات من بينها طلاء الأبقار بخطوط الحمير الوحشية لإبعاد الذباب عنها، وطهو الصلصة الإيطالية من دون تكوّن كِتل، على مكافآت نسخة ساخرة من جوائز "نوبل"، تحتفي بالبحث العلمي ولكن بطريقة مرحة.

title: شهادة مدير "إف بي آي" تحسم قضية إبستين.. ماذا قال؟
summary: أكد مدير مكتب التحقيقات الفدرالي "إف بي آي"، كاش باتيل، الثلاثاء، أنه لا توجد "معلومات موثوقة" في الملفات القضائية تشير إلى أن الممول الثري جيفري إبستين، المدان بجرائم جنسية، وفّر فتيات قاصرات لأشخاص آخرين.
